title: Understanding Vocational Therapists
text: Vocational therapists play a crucial role in helping students transition from school to work or further education. They focus on career development and preparing students for independence.

title: Key Responsibilities
text: Consider the main responsibilities of vocational therapists. They are involved in career development and preparing students for life after school.

hintAnswer: provide expertise in $$post-secondary$$ education and employment option and focus on career development and preparing students for independence and for integration into a $$post-secondary$$ school, work, or community environment
title: Identifying the Correct Role
text: Which of the following best describes the role of vocational therapists?
choices: assess and evaluate students with ASD, develop behavior plans, conduct social groups, and $$\frac{provide}{recommend}$$ other specialized interventions for students with ASD

provide expertise in $$post-secondary$$ education and employment option and focus on career development and preparing students for independence and for integration into a $$post-secondary$$ school, work, or community environment
support students with disabilities whose academic, behavioral, or $$social-emotional$$ issues interfere with their education
assess and provide intervention for issues of strength and stamina, postural control, functional mobility, coordination, and general motor behavior
